means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 特威斯特语源不详，可能是职业名称，棉纺业中负责用纱绕成绳索者

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"弯，弯曲"之意。
means: curve ： 指变成曲线或弧线状的动作或状态。
bend ： 普通用词，指把某物变成曲线或角形。用于人时，指头部或身躯弯下。
bow ： 指把头部或上身弯向前方的动作，也指社交中的礼节性动作。
crook ： 指不规则的弯曲，也指按照规则或模型弯曲某物。
twist ： 指通过转动、拧或扭使某物成弯曲状。

word_mean: twist-on connector 借助于轴向力进行插合并依靠锁定装置的旋转进行锁定的连接器。
在单纱、网线或绳索上所加捻的每一扭转。
netting machine 由各组线股加捻并相互交叉编织成网片的机械。

sentence.Network_en: The battle of the sexes also took a new twist.
sentence.Network_cn: 两性之争也出现了新的变数。

sentence.Network_en: Twist the mixture into individual sausages without splitting the skins.
sentence.Network_cn: 将混合物拧成一段段的香肠，不要把皮弄破。

be left in a state of suspense or uncertainty

lj.lj_ly: the twists and turns of her political career.

lj.lj_ly: If you twist my arm, I'll stay for a second beer.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (as a noun), of Germanic origin: probably from the base of twin and twine. Current verb senses date from late Middle English

entry.def: If you twist something, you turn it to make a spiral shape, for example by turning the two ends of it in opposite directions.

example.ex: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried...
example.tran: 她双手开始捻弄手提包的拎带。

example.ex: Twist the string carefully around the second stem with the other hand...
example.tran: 用另外一只手小心地把细绳缠绕到第二根茎上。

entry.tran: (使)(尤指身体部位)弯曲变形;(使)扭曲
entry.def: If you twist something, especially a part of your body, or if it twists, it moves into an unusual, uncomfortable, or bent position, for example because of being hit or pushed, or because you are upset.

example.ex: He twisted her arms behind her back and clipped a pair of handcuffs on her wrists...
example.tran: 他把她的胳膊扭到背后，在她手腕上拷上一副手铐。

example.ex: Sophia's face twisted in pain...
example.tran: 索菲娅疼得脸都扭曲了。

entry.def: If you twist part of your body such as your head or your shoulders, you turn that part while keeping the rest of your body still.

example.ex: She twisted her head sideways and looked towards the door...
example.tran: 她侧头朝门看去。

example.ex: Susan twisted round in her seat until she could see Graham and Sabrina behind her...
example.tran: 苏珊在座位上扭来扭去，直到她看见身后的格雷厄姆和萨布丽娜。

entry.def: If you twist a part of your body such as your ankle or wrist, you injure it by turning it too sharply, or in an unusual direction.

example.ex: He fell and twisted his ankle...
example.tran: 他摔倒了，扭伤了脚踝。

example.ex: Rupert Moon is out of today's session with a twisted knee.
example.tran: 鲁珀特·穆恩扭伤了膝盖，无法参加今天的训练。

entry.def: If you twist something, you turn it so that it moves around in a circular direction.

example.ex: She was staring down at her hands, twisting the ring on her finger...
example.tran: 她低头盯着双手，转动手指上的戒指。

example.ex: She twisted the handle and opened the door…
example.tran: 她转动门把手打开了门。

entry.def: If a road or river twists, it has a lot of sudden changes of direction in it.

example.ex: The roads twist round hairpin bends...
example.tran: 道路呈U字形蜿蜒曲折。

example.ex: The lane twists and turns between pleasant but unspectacular cottages.
example.tran: 小径在令人惬意而又毫不起眼的村舍间迂回曲折。

entry.def: If you say that someone has twisted something that you have said, you disapprove of them because they have repeated it in a way that changes its meaning, in order to harm you or benefit themselves.

example.ex: It's a shame the way that the media can twist your words and misrepresent you...
example.tran: 媒体歪曲他人言论、曲解他人意图的做法真是可耻。

example.ex: Even remarks that were quite innocent could be twisted to produce an unintended effect.
example.tran: 即便完全没有恶意的话都会被歪曲，以达到并非说话人本意的效果。

entry.def: A twist in something is an unexpected and significant development.

example.ex: …the twists and turns of economic policy…
example.tran: 经济政策的一波三折

example.ex: The battle of the sexes also took a new twist...
example.tran: 两性之争也出现了新的变数。

entry.def: A twist is the shape that something has when it has been twisted.

example.ex: ...bunches of violets in twists of paper...
example.tran: 纸卷包裹的一束束紫罗兰

example.ex: A thin twist of smoke curled from the cottage's single chimney.
example.tran: 一缕盘旋的轻烟从农舍唯一的烟囱里缭绕升起。

entry.def: The twist is a dance that was popular in the 1960's, in which you twist your body and move your hips in an energetic way.
If something happens by a twist of fate, it happens by chance, and it is strange, interesting, or unfortunate in some way.

example.ex: By a curious twist of fate, cricket was also my favourite sport...
example.tran: 让人感到惊奇的是，板球碰巧也是我最喜欢的运动。

example.ex: In a cruel twist of fate, Ann's husband Bill is also suffering from the disease.
example.tran: 造物弄人，安的丈夫比尔也患上了那种病。

means.word_mean: 2. an interpretation of a text or action;

sentences.sentence: "they put an unsympathetic construction on his conduct"
"he would stoop to any device to win a point"

means.word_mean: 5. a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments;

sentences.sentence: "the wrench to his knee occurred as he fell"
"he was sidelined with a hamstring pull"

means.word_mean: 6. a sharp bend in a line produced when a line having a loop is pulled tight
7. a miniature whirlpool or whirlwind resulting when the current of a fluid doubles back on itself
9. a hairdo formed by braiding or twisting the hair
10. social dancing in which couples vigorously twist their hips and arms in time to the music; was popular in the 1960s;
11. the act of winding or twisting;

sentences.sentence: "he put the key in the old clock and gave it a good wind"
"with a quick twist of his head he surveyed the room"

means.word_mean: 1. to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling);

sentences.sentence: "The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace"

means.word_mean: 2. cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form;

sentences.sentence: "the strong man could turn an iron bar"

means.word_mean: 7. twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates;

sentences.sentence: "a deep sigh was wrenched from his chest"

means.word_mean: 8. practice sophistry; change the meaning of or be vague about in order to mislead or deceive
9. twist suddenly so as to sprain;

sentences.sentence: "the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell"
"I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days"

auth_sentence.res_content: Everybody loves a story that ends with a twist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everybody loves a story that ends with a twist.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps there'll be another twist in this story.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perhaps there'll be another twist in this story.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps there'll be another twist in this story.

stems_affixes.word_buile: twi二,两+form形状+ed……的→adj.有两种形式的
twi二,两+n→adj.&n. 双胞胎[的],双[的],成对[的]

Sentence.sentence: Sure I did, but I think they twisted the meaning of what he said.
That could turn out to be the cruellest of all the twists to the Obama effect.

sentences.cn: 突然, 蛇扭动了一下。

sentences.en: She twisted her ankle when she fell.
He twisted the three ropes to make one very strong rope.
sentences.cn: 他把三根绳子搓在一起, 做成了一根结实的绳子。

sentences.en: You have to twist the lid off, not pull it.
sentences.cn: 盖子是拧开的, 不是拉开的。

sentences.en: They always twisted the facts to suit their purpose.
sentences.cn: 为了达到自己的目的, 他们总是歪曲事实。

means.word_mean: 弯曲, 曲折处，急转弯处

sentences.en: The mountain road is full of twists.
There's an unusual twist to the plot at the end of the book.
sentences.cn: 在这本书的末尾, 情节发生了不寻常的转折。

jushi.english: The metal frame tends to twist under pressure.
jushi.chinese: 这种金属框受压后容易变形。
